document.masterDocTitle: A recent bat survey reveals Bukit Barisan Selatan Landscape as a chiropteran diversity hotspot in Sumatra

subSubSection.paragraph: Lampung Province : Kuyung Arang Village, Lombok Village, Sukabanjar Village, Sidodadi Village, Sukaraja Village, Sukaraja Forest, Sumberjaya Village, Sumber Rejo Village, Way Canguk Forest.
Two individuals were collected as voucher specimens. Lampung Province : Sumberjaya Village, 1♂ , 1♀ ( MZB 34959, 34960).

caption.paragraph: TABLE 2. Measurements of nine external traits of 52 bat species. FA — forearm length, BM — body mass, HB — head and body length, TL — tail length, TB — tibia length, HF — hind foot length, TU — thumb length: EL — ear length, TR — tragus length. Numbers denote minimum and maximum, and sample size; values in parentheses indicate measurements of specimens of this study; ‘ – ’: data not available. BMs for specimens were taken in the field. All measurements in mm, except for BM (in g)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eonycteris spelaea
was common throughout the study area, but more abundant in coffee plantations than in forest. One individual was caught with mist nets above the Way Canguk River. It is easily distinguished from other pteropodids by the lack of a claw on the second finger. Individuals were observed feeding on flowers of kapok (
Ceiba pentandra
) and coconut palm (
Cocos nucifera
) in Sumber Rejo Village (JCCH, personal observation). It has been recorded roosting with
Rousettus
bats in a cave in Way Canguk Forest (MN, unpublished data).
